comments:
I20031202

- I started a background synchronize
- did some work in a Java file
- saved it
- Ctrl+B 
- got a dialog telling me that the build is blocked
- build started after a while
- after build was finished, the sync in background stopped with the following
  errors

An error occured while synchronizing with remote contents.
  An error occurred 
refreshing /org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring/resources: I/O has been 
interrupted.
  An error occurred refreshing /org.eclipse.jdt.ui/ui: Timeout while writing 
to output stream

Don't know if this is relating but it occurred right after the build had 
finished.
Was there anything in the log?

Yes ;-). Many of the following stack traces

I can't duplicate this. Following your scenario I sometimes get the dialog but 
most time don't and the build completes and doesn't interrupt the background 
sync. I'll keep an eye out for this scenario in M6.

I got this two times today again. Once doing the build in background and once 
starting editing a Java file. It don't believe that this is a coincidence. If 
I don't touch my keyboard during a catch-up everything works fine, but if I 
work in parallel I am "sometimes" confronted with broken CVS connection. May 
be the difference is that we work from Europa over a 2MBit connection ;-).

Have you tried changing the timeout value? The default is 60 seconds, which is 
fairly long, but over the europa 2Mbit connection, it may make a difference to 
increase this value. Let me know if this helps.

Even setting this to a high value didn't help. But we experience some other 
network problems today as well.

Are you still experiencing this now that the ZRH network problems have been
addressed?
I will keep an eye on it and will let you know... I didn't got it today.

I think this was related to ZRH network problems. Closing, but please open
another bug if this happens again.

traces.message: Timeout while writing to output stream
